Body: A main thing the Optimality Theory explains with the previous theories did not, is how different phonological 'rules' which do not seem to have something in common, or by the way the are formed cannot be collapsed into one process, actually are a part of a 'conspiracy' which is meant to serve a single purpose (the prevention of a form the language phonology does not allow etc..), in the Optimality Theory these restrictions are formed as constraints and allow a description which unites different processes which serve the same purpose as being a part of the same process.
